thread.title: A big bird looms over mid-town park
thread.title_full: A big bird looms over mid-town park | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Mark Oswald / Journal Staff Writer
title: A big bird looms over mid-town park
text:
This big, fat raptor, identified by the amateur ornithologists at the Journal North as a red tailed hawk, was perched at the top of a tree in the undeveloped open space portion of Southridge/Calle Lorca Park Thursday morning in mid-town Santa Fe.
This red-tailed hawk was keeping an eye on Southridge/Calle Lorca park earlier this week. (Mark Oswald/Journal)
A group of ravens tried incessantly for at least a half-hour or so to the hassle the hawk with caws and fly-bys, to no avail.
Judging from the hawk’s girth, it hasn’t been having much trouble finding prey in the neighborhood. Cat and small dog owners probably should be on the lookout.
